snippet: Affidavits portray a scene of confusion as three young men, stunned to realize their friend Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was being sought as a terrorist, debated whether to help him.
abstract: Three friends of Boston Marathon bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev are charged with impeding inquiry into attacks; Kazakh immigrants Dias Kadyrbayev and Azamat Tazhayakov are charged with concealing evidence to obstruct federal inquiry, and their American friend Robel K Phillipos is charged with lying to impede investigation.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ian Lovett and Jess Bidgood from Boston; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; William K. Rashbaum and Serge F. Kovaleski from New York; and Kitty Bennett from St. Petersburg, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Affidavits portray a scene of confusion as three young men, stunned to realize their friend Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was being sought as a terrorist, debated whether to help him.

headline.main: After Boston Attack, 3 Friends Covered It Up, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: 3 Accused of Impeding Boston Bombing Inquiry
